qas.question: What is the maximum percentage of seats a single party can control?
How many seats of the uninominal elections did the PRD get in the 2006 elections?
Why does the government prevent more than 63% of a party to control the legislature?

context: Even though proportionality is confined to the proportional seats to prevent a part from being overrepresented, several restrictions apply in the assignation of the seats; namely, that no party can have more than <a0_0>63<a0_0/>% of all seats, both uninominal and plurinominal. In the 2006 elections leftist PRD got the absolute majority in the direct uninominal elections, securing <a1_0>34<a1_0/> of the 40 FPP seats. As such, the PRD was not assigned any plurinominal seat to comply with the law that prevents <a2_0>over-representation<a2_0/>. The overall composition of the Legislative Assembly is:
